definition: to cross/to go over/to pass (time)/to celebrate (a holiday)/to live/to get along/excessively/too-

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Playing house, they learn more about how parents feel about their children.
sentences.chinese: 玩儿过家家时，他们学习父母如何关心孩子。

sentences.english: Playing house has got to be one of the worst games to play as an adult.
sentences.chinese: 一个成年人最不想玩的游戏之一就是过家家。

sentences.english: Chloe has just got her first play house. Yippee !
sentences.chinese: 我们为小克买了她第一个过家家的小房子。

sentences.english: I always felt like I was playing house at these brunches.
sentences.chinese: 这种早午餐总是给我一种过家家的感觉。

sentences.english: We bought the latest rages. Baby-Sitter's Club dolls and a doll house.
sentences.chinese: 我们买了最新的过家家的人偶玩具准备作为礼物。

sentences.english: I didn't want it to look like kids getting married.
sentences.chinese: 我不想让这看起来像是小孩子过家家。

sentences.english: Her sister came back from school, and we also had the cloth doll plays a game of the game every household.
sentences.chinese: 姐姐放学回来了，我们又和布娃娃玩起了过家家游戏。

sentences.english: Kids who play pretend with their friends do a lot of talking.
sentences.chinese: 过家家的游戏可以增加孩子对他人的认同感。

sentences.english: How long do you think we can play house?
sentences.chinese: 你觉得我们能在这儿玩多久过家家？

definition: to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
to play rubber band jump rope
merry-go-round/carousel/Carousel, South Korean TV soap opera
to play games/to joke around/to play a joke on sb
